description: From kid +‎ nap (“to nab; to grab”).

entries.meaning: The crime, or an instance, of kidnapping.

verbs.description: kidnap (third-person singular simple present kidnaps, present participle kidnapping or kidnaping, simple past and past participle kidnapped or kidnaped)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To seize or detain a person unlawfully and move or conceal them; sometimes for ransom.
